intro: Aethusa montana, commonly known as the mountain cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, erect stem and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Aethusa montana is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It is not commonly cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
